caption.title: HIV prevalence and incidence in year 2000 vs. percentage of black tar heroin used in several major U.S. cities.
caption.p: Blue cities correspond to eastern US, green cities to western US. Prevalence is depicted with circles and city names are centered around it. Squares denote 1996 incidence per 500 person-years in cities where it was reported in Holmberg [ 9]. Prevalence and incidence in the same city are liked with a segment. Horizontal line represents 5% prevalence and incidence per 500 person years. Incidence was scaled to 500 person-years to get numeric values within the same numeric range as the prevalence. HIV prevalence and incidence from Tempalski et al. [ 8]; prevalence of black tar in the cities as reported in Ciccarone and Bourgois [ 6], from Domestic Monitoring Program 1991â€“1993. Drug Enforcement Administration, U.S. Department of Justice.
